cyclone.name: MICHAEL
cyclone.current_location: about 20 mi southwest of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north across the southeastern Gulf, forecast to turn northeast after landfall and track across GA–SC–NC into the Mid-Atlantic before reaching the Atlantic Ocean south of New Jersey

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Alabama/Florida border to Suwannee River FL; Tropical-Storm Watch: Suwannee River to Anna Maria Island FL and Alabama/Florida border to MS/AL border; Storm-Surge Watch: Navarre FL to Anna Maria Island FL including Tampa Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Pinar del Rio Cuba; Tropical-Storm Warning: Isle of Youth (Cuba) and Tulum–Cabo Catoche (Mexico)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast of FL (Panhandle/Big Bend) then inland GA–SC–NC and Mid-Atlantic coast (VA–MD–DE–NJ)
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤9%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Thu–early Fri; gusty 25–35 kt possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected for upper Chesapeake Bay; minor tidal departures possible
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized 6 inch totals possible Thu night–Fri, causing flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated river/urban flooding and hazardous harbor conditions from strong northeasterly gradient winds
